codes.name: URBAN_DECAY
codes.definition: Descriptions of ruins, decay, abandoned spaces

codes.name: BELLONA_CITY
codes.definition: Specific references to Bellona as setting

codes.name: TEXTUAL_ARTIFACT
codes.definition: Text as physical object within text

codes.name: SETTING
codes.definition: Description of time, place, or environment

codes.name: SEARCHING
codes.definition: Character seeking or looking for something

codes.name: ALIENATION
codes.definition: Sense of separation from others or self

codes.name: AUTONOMY
codes.definition: Value placed on independence and self-direction

codes.name: ORDER
codes.definition: Value placed on structure and stability

codes.name: CHAOS
codes.definition: Value placed on disruption and uncertainty

codes.name: TRUTH
codes.definition: Value placed on authenticity and reality

codes.name: POWER
codes.definition: Value placed on control and influence

codes.name: JUSTICE
codes.definition: Value placed on fairness and equity

Shorter Views
Samuel R. Delany
Dhalgren
Samuel R. Delany was born and grew up in New York
City's Harlem. He is best known as the author of science
fiction aud fantasy novels, and his books have won both
Hugo and Nebula awards. He has also published several
books of nonfiction, including critical studies of literature,
a volume of memoirs, and the bestselling Times Square
Red, Times Square Blue. Delany is a professor of creative
writing and English at Temple University in Philadelphia.

memos.title: Circular Structure
memos.content: Dhalgren's circular structure creates endless loop reflecting temporal anomalies in Bellona

memos.title: Identity Without Origin
memos.content: Kid's amnesia enables identity construction outside dominant categories

memos.title: Queer Relationality
memos.content: Polyamory and fluid sexuality presented as viable alternatives
